intro: Prunus avium lusus pendula, commonly known as the weeping cherry tree, is a cultivar of the sweet cherry tree. It is characterized by its cascading branches that create a distinctive, ornamental shape. The tree produces showy, pinkish-white flowers in early spring, followed by edible red cherries in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun for optimal growth. This variety is popular in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and seasonal beauty.
